intro: Peristylus timorensis, commonly known as the Timor peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
